title: [Erigon + Prysm] Infinite Loop After Runtime Error `runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference`
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: `2022.09.1-alpha-4067b7c4`

Prysm version: `3.1.1`

OS & Version: `Linux ethereum-erigon 5.4.0-125-generic #141-Ubuntu SMP Wed Aug 10 13:42:03 UTC 2022 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux`

#### Expected behaviour

Erigon Syncing with Mainnet post-merge.

#### Actual behaviour

Erigon keeps trying to catch-up but always fails due to unwinding after this log message:

```zsh
WARN[09-15|20:50:04.290] Unexpected header                        hash=0x78c1c271074042eaeb85d9650fd4c486cd58ee464810ed1719623620e858cd79 expected=0x74e11e00f1e45812dbf9da130d819acc5174926c494963ef1e6b5fe8709b25c5
```

Erigon keeps working for ~1 hour then this error log show up:

````zsh
EROR[09-15|22:07:03.399] Staged Sync                              err="runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference, trace: [stageloop.go:129 panic.go:890 panic.go:260 signal_unix.go:835 fork_validator.go:279 fork_validator.go:216 stage_headers.go:673 collector.go:276 collector.go:144 stage_headers.go:686 stage_headers.go:732 stage_headers.go:195 stage_headers.go:163 default_stages.go:20 sync.go:352 sync.go:255 stageloop.go:163 stageloop.go:84 asm_amd64.s:1594]"
````

Few seconds later, Erigon falls into infinite loop with this logs:

````zsh
INFO[09-15|22:08:02.973] RPC Daemon notified of new headers       from=15541313 to=15541337 header sending=65.39µs log sending=434ns
INFO[09-15|22:08:02.973] [1/15 Headers] Waiting for Beacon Chain...
INFO[09-15|22:08:02.973] [1/15 Headers] Fork choice missing header with hash 77052c9c241525ec9458932fede7bd346dcd5f0ac8708b8e493ea48566782128
INFO[09-15|22:08:02.975] Commit cycle                             in=16.906µs
````

### YAML Config 

````yaml
# -----------------
# Basics
# -----------------
chain: "mainnet"
datadir: "/mnt/data"
history.v2: "false"
watch-the-burn: "true"
snapshots: "true"
healthcheck: "true"

# -----------------
# P2P
# -----------------
nat: "extip:<SNIP>"
port: "<SNIP>"
maxpeers: "200"
v5disc: "true"

# -----------------
# Json-RPC Over HTTP
# -----------------
http: "true"
http.trace: "false"
http.compression: "false"
http.addr: "0.0.0.0"
http.port: "8545"
http.api: "eth,erigon,engine,web3,net,debug,trace,txpool,db,parity"
http.vhosts: "*"
http.corsdomain: "*"

# -----------------
# Json-RPC Over WebSocket
# -----------------
ws: "true"
ws.compression: "false"

# -----------------
# Engine API
# -----------------
authrpc.addr: "0.0.0.0"
authrpc.port: "8551"
authrpc.vhosts: "*"

# -----------------
# Private API
# -----------------
private.api.addr: "0.0.0.0:9090"

# -----------------
# Memory Pool
# -----------------
txpool.globalslots: "1000000"
txpool.globalbasefeeslots: "1000000"
txpool.globalqueue: "1000000"
txpool.lifetime: "720h"

# -----------------
# Downloader
# -----------------
torrent.maxpeers: "1"
torrent.upload.rate: "1kb"
torrent.download.rate: "1mb"
no-downloader: "false"

# -----------------
# Metrics
# -----------------
metrics.addr: "0.0.0.0"
metrics.port: "6070"
metrics: "true"
metrics.expensive: "true"

# -----------------
# pprof
# -----------------
pprof.addr: "0.0.0.0"
pprof.port: "6060"
pprof: "true"
````
### Logs

````zsh

````

We also encounter similar `runtime error` on `Staged Sync`:
```
Staged Sync                              err="runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference, trace: [stageloop.go:129 panic.go:844 panic.go:220 signal_unix.go:818 fork_validator.go:279 fork_validator.go:216 stage_headers.go:673 collector.go:276 collector.go:144 stage_headers.go:686 stage_headers.go:732 stage_headers.go:195 stage_headers.go:163 default_stages.go:20 sync.go:352 sync.go:255 stageloop.go:163 stageloop.go:84 asm_amd64.s:1571]"
```
Is it related to this `pending=10000` `queued=10000` just before the staged sync error?
```
Sep 16 01:41:26 erigon-1 erigon[526931]: txpool_1      | [INFO] [09-16|01:41:26.114] [txpool] stat                            block=15542990 pending=10000 baseFee=10000 queued=10000 cache_keys=2898 alloc=93.2MB sys=735.1MB
```
We run the same erigon `2022.09.1-alpha-4067b7c4` but with lighthouse `v3.1.0-modern`.

Here are our logs:

Seeing the same with erigon (`2022.08.03-alpha` and `2022.09.01-alpha`) + nimbus

As a workaround, Ii run this script every minute to restart erigon if it enters this state:
```bash
#!/bin/bash

set -eu
date
ERIGON_PID=$(systemctl show --property MainPID --value erigon.service)

OK=1
journalctl -u erigon.service -S "-1h" -g "invalid memory address" --output-fields _PID -o cat  | grep -x $ERIGON_PID && OK=0

if [ $OK -ne 1 ]; then
        echo "Erigon's dead, restarting"
        systemctl restart erigon.service
else
        echo "Erigon's healthy"
fi
```
